channel.title: The Rulez
channel.description:
[url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,274272.0.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,274272.0.html[/url]
The above link is a link to the rules that from the looks of it, barely anyone has read.
I have found though, that the rules themselves are quite sketchy and could use a new explanation to those of who need better clarification. These rules have been re-clarified based on my perception on how things truly work around here.
For clarification, these [i]rules[/i] where written with the General Discussion board in mind.
[b]Rule 1:[/b] Everyone is not equal. If your new, you have virtually no say against someone who has been here a long time. Respect your elders or be prepared to have a face full of flame. You must prove your worth before anyone will take you seriously and back you up.
[b]Rule 2:[/b] Should you post something completely idiotic, it is basically up to the first 3 posts as to whether your thread is locked. if the first 3 posts call your thread stupid, then your thread will be locked. If the first 3 posts change the topic or post hilarious remarks about your post, then it will stay till a mod gets bored and decides to close it.
[b]Rule 3:[/b] Post count, rep and statuses don't mean anything. The only thing that matters is how many people know you and whether or not they respect you.
[i]On the subject of rule 3:[/i] Rep is a little reward for helping the community, so since no one here really helps the community, its a useless feature.
[b]Rule 4:[/b] We only have one forum account per person. A few people in the past have abused this and made more than one account. They where banned, hunted down. We still don't know what happened to the last guy who broke this rule...
[b]Rule 5:[/b] Do not advertise without permission from a Global Moderator or an Administrator. In all realism, by the time the mod or admin you ask gets back to you with the most likely answer of 'no', the link will either be dead, or you will have forgotten why you asked in the first place.
[b]Rule 6:[/b] While it is hilarious to make people look at penises and gay sex when they think there going to watch a cartoon, its frowned upon. Mainly by the people that fall for suck obvious tricks. Posting a misleading link and having a mod click it and get laughed at for looking at 2 guys doing it, will result in you being punished.
[b]Rule 7:[/b] A moderators decision is final, if you have a problem with it, tough. Trying to resolve it through a bitching about it in a thread will not only result in a heavier punishment, but also everyone flaming you for being a whiny little bitch.

item.title: The Rulez
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

  1. So, I have to respect someone who acts like a complete moron? Yes, because that is going to want to make me stay here. Everyone is equal, and therefore is treated the same. In some cases, it is completely normal for a member that has been here longer to be more severely disciplined than someone that has not, as they know better.

  2. We don’t let members decide if a thread is worthy or not. We leave that to the moderators. Whether or not any post in the thread is valid may or may not determine whether or not a thread is locked. It is at the discretion of the moderator if a thread is worthy.

  3. Not really a rule, it’s more of something we just tell people. Rep means nothing, post count means nothing. Maturity and attitude is what means something in this community. I couldn’t give a shit how many people respect a certain user if they are mature and have a good attitude.

Reputation points may be given for helping a certain user or doing something well, or in a mature manner. Who ever stereotyped rep to helping the community?

  1. If a user owns more then one account every account the user owns is banned. End of story, no questions asked.

  2. On the subject of this, if you pm a global moderator or administrator about being able to post a thread, do not post the thread until you have received a sure-fire answer you are allowed to do so.

  3. Misleading links and linking to (child) porn will result mainly in a ban. Use common sense.

  4. If you have a problem with a certain moderator, please pm them about it. If you believe they have portrayed a wrong action, pm them regarding it. DO NOT MAKE A THREAD ABOUT IT. Doing so will result in strict punishment towards you.

I truly don’t see a large difference between the current rules and these other then having to respect members that have been here longer, which is certainly something that will not be stood for. In addition, if you have an idea for a rule, please pm a staff member. Creating an entire set of rules has, and will continue to be a job of the staff.

Read full topic
